title: Within days, Zac lowest winrate in jungle
body:
What deadweight braindead briefstain greenlit this odious POS rework anyway?

Went from a go-to champ to my team consistently HATING me every game I TRY to play this worthless garbage

Zac rework is a JOKE. You can't do anything; inane impractical Q and R, rest of his kit is dragged down into obsolescence. Did they even test out this travesty in applied gameplay or just fold their arms and say AAAYYYYYYYYYYYY wacky Zac thematic clarity!!!

Worst champ in the game now, easy.

replies.body:
I don't think that winrate is relevant, if it's low he'll get buff.

But the rework? Yeah it's a joke. His new ult is garbage, underwhelming, clunky, unreliable, boring, less useful. Anything you can think could get worse about his ult actually happened.

I don't really like his new Q, but i'm kinda fine with it though, it's less reliable, but it has more CC potential.

I'm just crossing my fingers and hope that they revert his ult.

>I don't think that winrate is relevant, if it's low he'll get buff.

My concern is that we'll reach a point where it takes so long to buff him, that the only people left playing Zac are those really dedicated folks, who have all tanked 200+ MMR across the board. I know they're tanking across the board because they collectively have 42~% win rate.

Take an 1800 MMR player and put him in 1550 MMR, his win rate will go up. But that doesn't mean he's *better*.

I am #13 Zac mastery points in world (higher if you combined my 4 accounts) and I am reaching my breaking point after this rework.  I find glimmers of fun as support, but no where near the joy I used to have playing this champion.  Zac's playrate went from 6.5% to 4.5% and tanking.  There really wont be anyone playing him but the OTP's like me, and even I am reaching my limit.

reverts in rito? :')

I feel the same. I like the new Q, but halving the cc on his E was an immense Nerf to his ganks too, which was unneeded and uncalled for. 

In my opinion they liked very much the concept of the new ult, and nerfed E knockup just because they didn't want 1 E = guaranteed scoop. Simply put, they didn't even think of the impact of such a change.

My suggestion is not to revert the ult, but to make it so casting R without charging up would just do his old ult. The scoop is too risky and situational to be Zac's ultimate ability.

I'm shocked that Riot completely face planted on another class rework. I don't know why they feel the need to force one out every half season, when they're not needed. Their VGUs are spectacular. They almost always hit the nail on the head. But these full class reworks, they've been disgusting. Every one starting with the marksman update. Graves is a disaster now. Quinn still has the most boring and difficult to balance kit in the class. MYMU completely and utterly destroyed  Malzahar and alienated his mains, fucked with Annie's R hitbox so that now, you don't know if the target will be stunned or not, turned Zyra into a balance nightmare (still can't go mid), and removed so much AP from the game that mages feel worthless until 5 items. Their assassin update was whack too. Kat is impossible to balance, Leblanc is a joke. These class reworks have all been progress for the sake of progress. Only no progress is made. I'm quite tired of class updates. Please stick to VGUs.
Honestly, it would be nice if they stuck largely to the itemization when handling the class reworks rather than kits.

I feel they should have done the opposite of what they decided to do with class reworks from here on out. They shouldn't make big changes to like 3 different champs but lots of small changes to lots of champs. Small tune ups and QOL changes.
Either that or go completely in the other direction and commit to a single VGU sized update with smaller tweaks to other champs. And when I say smaller I mean maybe up to Amumu scale.
The "lots of little changes to everyone" is how Vel'koz ended up getting booty punched.
I prefer little changes that can be easily tweaked or reverted over something like Skarner's rework where they've made new assets that they're not likely to pull any time soon.
Agreed.
Oh damn, you even forgot the crappy Juggernaut update. I know it was bad, but I didn't know it was "make you want to forget it" bad.
Hahaha. Ya, so essentially, every single class update they've done has been nothing short of a colossal failure.

I don't even get why they spent so much time and effort into reworking Zac to begin with.  Apart from his long range engage, there wasn't anything too problematic with his kit.  I feel as though Malphite would have been a better candidate for a mini rework.

Ya, Malphite is on the list for a full VGU. That's my takeaway from this "tank update"- none of the three really needed reworks. They were all relatively unique. If they were going to do a tank update, why wasn't it {{champion:36}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:33}} ? These guys needed reworked worse than anyone. But no, Riot HAS to get a class update out every half season for no particularly good reason. So these 3 already fine champions got the treatment. Nothing irritates me more in this game than the class updates.
Mundo isn't tank
Mundo is the quintessential tank.
Mundo doesn't have any CC, so he's a Juggernaut. "Tanks" as in the tank being referred to, are Vanguards, people whose job is CC and Tanking, as opposed to damage and tanking.

Ya, riot has needlessly broken down each class into a million different sub categories that no one knows or cares about. If you're last pick, and your team says they need a tank, mundo is one of the first champions that comes to mind.

There's like two subclasses for each Champion type...and they help set ideas and definitions for what each class should do. And not really, that may just be *you*. When I think Tank, I think Naut, Maokai, Sej, Galio, and Sion way before I think Mundo, because they provide nessecary CC. A Yi is going to tear through a Mundo like nothing come late game, while real tanks can lock Yi down to help others kill him.
Fair enough. I do think "subclasses" still fit under a bigger umbrella. And I think the bigger umbrella here is "tank."

They reworked him because once he engaged with E and ult his usefulness was only defined by how much damage he could do with Q being a generic slow and W being a spamable damage ability. I feel that the Q change was definitely warranted since the old one was forgetable but the ult change feels unnecessary though we'll see if they try to alter it at all to make it better. Though as a former Skarner player I doubt that.

There are changes on the PBE.
For example: the duration of the knock up on E scales with how long you charged it.

A fully charged E will knock up enemies for 1 second... which is the time you need to charge the ult.
It should get alot more reliable that way and a reliable kidnap ability with that long ranged engage actually seems quite strong.
Eh, not what I meant by alter it but we'll see how it goes.

I've been a Zac main for years. He was my favorite champion. Old ult was flexible because you could use it both offensively and defensively. It was so satisfying landing in the enemy team with E then press R to bounce around causing havoc in teamfights, it even had some skill in positioning in which direction you wanted enemies to land. He felt so active, radical and crazy! Now he feels clunky as hell. I can agree on Q feeling a bit uninspired and samey to W so I wouldn't have minded a rework on that. But sacrificing R for more CC on Q and 'reactionary counterplay' was not the way to go. With 'reactionary counterplay' I think they saw E knockup to R knockup had little counterplay so they made this be-a-pizza-for-1-sec thing so enemies could react to his cc plays. But that's not an argument imo because other champions have even crazier combos. Why bounce around having fun when you can stand still, become a pizza for a few seconds then bounce 1 time a few yards away. So interactive and fun! I'd rather have you keep the old Q and delete the slow just to have old R back. 

I loved old Fiora, they remade her so I went to old Shen. I loved old Shen, they remade him so I went to Zac. Now Zac is dead to me too. The only thing I have left in this game is Udyr. Once they screw him up with a rework I'm done with this game.

Riot seriously needs to cut back on staff. They've become so bloated with employees they need to find problems where there aren't any just to keep employees busy. Zac had ZERO reason to be reworked but people gotta get paid, right? These half assed reworks is gonna cost Riot in the long run. Enjoy your comfy office work while it lasts.

When they buffed rivens ult in season 6, her win rate went DOWN. This is because a lot of people who don't play her enough, thought she might be op, lost a dropped the win rate.

Bandwagon players and people testing out new changes DESTROY the validity of the total win rate of champions. They create stats on champions with their first 5 to 10 games ever on them, which usually are losses and lower the win rate. 

If you could filter off everyone with < 100 games before the rework, that number would be a lot more meaningful

I was a zac main for a while. I haven't played the new zac yet, but I have no idea why they changed him. To me, he was one of the most unique champs in the game. He was powerful, but he could be beat. He was balanced. He was already different there was no need to change or update his kit. I really have no desire to play him now. 

IMO that was one the most unnecessary changes I've seen in the last 2 years.

Except if you look at Winrate by Mains, you'll see a 52% winrate. While that is still low for a Champion's main winrate, it proves more that he's just weak and the rework isn't the problem.

Yeah, he's most likely weak and needs buffs, I don't think that's debatable, but it's really not the rework. It's the numbers.

I don't think it's just the numbers.... like what are you supposed to do with that ult in teamfights? (it is of course good for ganking)

It is a worse Poppy ult when used defensively (pulling enemies away from his team) since then Zac has to go with his target instead of staying and trying to take advantage of the numbers advantage

It is a worse Blitz hook when used offensively... kind off?... it is easier to hit the target you want (if Zac lands E) however it is more difficult to avoid pulling with you the targets you don't want like the enemy tanks which often have AoE CC (since the enemy tanks are often close enough to their carries that they can walk onto Zac while he is charging).. there is a reason Blitz tries to avoid pulling enemy tanks and juggernauts into his team

He can also use it like his old ult.... but then it's just worse then before isn't it?


Well it might be good just that I don't see it...

You can:

* Dive their back line and bring them to your front line

* Peel off front liners away from your team

* Send carries away so your team can deal with front liners alone

* Send their front line away so you can engage carries

* Become a major disruption in a teamfight, regardless of target, just by pooling

1: No Opportunities, due to increased unreliability.

2: No Opportunities, due to increased unreliability. But more likely than 1&3

3: No Opportunities, due to increased unreliability.

4: No Opportunities, due to increased unreliability. But more likely than 1&3

5: True, but old ult was better for that.
5 was the only thing that Ult could do well. The other things are completely possible in opportunity, especially with the Zac buffs incoming.

Watching Meteos last night said he actually likes the new Zac better and that it's more fun. Maybe not as powerful right now, but more fun.

Did you know that, like every other gaming company in the world, Riot is bad at balancing their game? There's no reason for League of Legends not to have severe balance problems when Riot releases a major update like this.
True but zac update could have been used on someone else. Malphite come to mind his kit is old he could use new animations  and splash art.
Malphite AND Rammus are getting VGUs as in full scale reworks, Zac, Sejauni and Maokai just needed touch ups

I won't argue about whether Zac's new kit is designed well or not, but if Zac has a low winrate right now it's because he's poorly balanced, not that he's poorly designed. Developers can actively design something to be well designed (although Riot has a hard time doing this in class updates), but developers cannot actively design something to be balanced. You can literally look at every competitive game (excluding games where every character is the same) and see that this is very much true.
Easily the worst rework Riot has ever done. Please admit your mistake and just revert the changes... and whoever green lit the rework, please also put in your resignation.
I wish he was viable because, honestly, I can see a balanced version of the kit being really fun to play.

I kind of find it difficult to see the best uses for Zac's ult in teamfights... it is of course great for ganking

He can use it to try and pick off immobile enemy carries but with the charge up enemy tanks will probably just step onto Zac and join in.... which means instead of a pick on the enemy carry it will turn into an all out fight
Which is kind of like a worse version of blitz hook which it is easier to hit the target you want (assuming Zac lands his E) however it is more difficult to not hit the targets you don't want (like the enemy tanks like {{champion:32}}  or something)

He can also use it to try and pull fights/juggernauts and such away from his carries.... but of course Zac will still be stuck with those fighters/juggernauts in his face
Which is kind like a worse version of Poppy ult... since with Poppy ult she sends the enemy away while she is still with her team creating an uneven fight while Zac has to go with his targets

Or he can double tap it for CC but then it's just worse version of his old ult
